metadata.title: CVE-2018-1000164 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
gunicorn version 19.4.5 contains a CWE-113: Improper Neutralization of CRLFSequences in HTTP Headers vulnerability in "process_headers" function in"gunicorn/http/wsgi.py" that can result in an attacker causing the serverto return arbitrary HTTP headers. This vulnerability appears to have beenfixed in 19.5.0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000164` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gunicorn - 19.4.5-1ubuntu1.1
gunicorn-examples - 19.4.5-1ubuntu1.1
gunicorn3 - 19.4.5-1ubuntu1.1
python-gunicorn - 19.4.5-1ubuntu1.1
python3-gunicorn - 19.4.5-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gunicorn package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '19.4.5-1ubuntu1.1').
